title: Girl, 6, is airlifted to hospital after a tree fell on top of her in Sydney park
text:
A six-year-old girl has been airlifted to hospital after she fell from a tree and landed on a branch.

The child injured her knee just before 3.30pm on Friday at a playground near Seaforth Oval on the city's northern beaches.

She will now undergo surgery at Westmead Children's Hospital after being airlifted from the scene by helicopter.

A six-year-old girl has been airlifted to hospital after she fell from a tree and landed on a branch (scene pictured)

An ambulance spokesman said her condition has now stabilised after being transported with her mother in the CareFlight Rescue Helicopter.

Paramedics and NSW Fire and Rescue teams were called to the scene after witnesses called triple zero just before 3.30pm.

Police were also called to the scene but were not required any further.

A New South Wales police spokesman said the incident was a result of 'misadventure' and said the child was injured when she landed on a stick.
description: A six-year-old girl has been airlifted to hospital after a tree fell on top of her in a park in north Sydney.
